subject: Re: [junit] Junit and RMI, please help ...
msgSnippet: The word orthogonal, the way you use it here, is not jargon. It is somewhat metaphoric, but otherwise correct. The word spike, however, is definitely jargon.

The word orthogonal, the way you use it here, is not jargon. It is somewhat metaphoric, but otherwise correct.

The word spike, however, is definitely jargon. :)

So said Levi Cook on 4/4/2003 --------------------

On Thursday, April 3, 2003, at 12:03  AM, skss2002@... wrote:

>> I would recommend writing a totally orthogonal spike.
>
> Huh?

Sorry... current project jargon inherited from various sources...

(spike: from XP literature? Becks white book)
(orthogonal: Pragmatic Programmer)

googling these would probably be informative.

"site:c2.com spike"
"site:c2.com orthogonal"

> Would you elaborate please?  For manually driven clients, do you mean
> something I have already tried?

Kinda, but less command-line oriented...

I'll post some code... its probably the easiest way to explain myself.

-- Levi
